subject: Initial version of pldm_fwup_pkg_creator.py
commitMessage:
Initial version of pldm_fwup_pkg_creator.py

pldm_fwup_pkg_creator.py is a python script that can generate a PLDM
firmware update package out of one or more image files, given a
corresponding metadata JSON file.

Signed-off-by: Deepak Kodihalli <deepak.kodihalli.83@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7655ab2be72731332afc686b1c55b1312455ba1a
Signed-off-by: Tom Joseph <rushtotom@gmail.com>

I haven't reviewed this code, but I see comments throughout about code style.

Since this is the first python script in this repository you should also `touch setup.cfg` in the root of the repo so that our CI will run `pycodestyle`.  There are a few line-length errors reported right now by `pycodestyle` with this commit.

Patch Set 8:

> Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1
> 
> Tom - I tested this an the package header seems incorrect (4 bytes less than expected).
In the first version VariableBitfield (ApplicableComponents) was hardcoded to 4 bytes, in the later version it was done based on the actual number of component mentioned in the json.

The package header will have a difference of 9 bytes between the 1st version and the last version with the sample JSON.

Patch Set 8:

I tested again with a 120M binary, the Total Final Size, PackageHeaderSize, Individual Component Offset, Individual Component Size all looks good.
Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 4ac93443680ea012fc9019734cb707893c5aa33b by Tom Joseph

nit: It might be nice to add arg parser for metadata file & images. i.e. pldm_fwup_pkg_creator.py [-h] -m metaDataFile -i [images ..]

Also, another option could be to select the specification version number. pldm_fwup_pkg_creator.py [-h] -m metaDataFile -i [images ..] [-v versionNum]
Ack
nit: This could be easily supported in script by taking this input from the meta-data file. It could be an optional field in the meta-data file
Right, this can be done.
Do you have plans of blocking down-level components down the line? Could be a potential security ask.
I think we will have such plans. The script can be enhanced to consume this.
nit: empty space
Ack
PackageHeaderIdentifier & packageReleaseDateTime can be made configurable.
python may not always be under /usr/bin. can we use #!/usr/bin/env python3 instead, this would be portable across different unix operating systems
Ack
can be sorted based on PEP8 ?
I've run autopep8.

Here and below, shouldn't we throw an exception instead and handle it in main()?
Without atexit handler we will left half-written "pldmFwUpPkg" file.
Ack
sys.exit() raises the system.exit() exception and is handled in the main() which removes the pldm-fwup-pkg.bin.
nit: shouldn't be the code be consistent of single/double quote usage?
Ack
nit: just use packageVersionString?
This is to get something like '20s', not sure I followed your comment.

It looks like:
packageVersionString = str(packageVersionStringLength)

Transforms to:
formatString = '<BB{}s'.format(packageVersionString)

nit: I would prefer string formatting for better reading of the struct's format spec.
This value can be set based on the DSP0267 version number. For 1.0.x this variable will have a different string.
Ack
Will it be better to define such values as constant at the top of the script?

Suggest to have default value of the spec as 1.1.x, but we could provide option for the user to select a different spec version. @Deepak, can we passdown the spec version as one of the input arguments?
if UUID can be done, i guess this as well can be based on the DSP0267 version number right ?
Ack
Should this be the number of components or the ComponentBitMapLength?
Let's define magic constant with corresponding name
Ack

These 2 parameters can be taken from the configuration (json) file as some firmwares may have addition metadata in the image which may not be used for firmware update or some firmwares may use only a subset of bytes from the firmware image used for packaging.
Yes, that can be an enhancement. Please feel free to push a commit that does this.
size of checksum to be added for calculating the offset of the images

Through out the file, Maybe having docstring helps.
Ex: 
"""
<function in brief>
:args:
:return:
"""
Ack
not used , can we not pass this?
not used ? duplicate variable ?
Ack
If we can not calculate the offset as a size of structure, let's define magic constant at the top of the file.
Ack
This is 2 bytes, so should be <H
typo
Ack
is it worth adding required=True for this argument as per the README ?
Ack
more than 80 characters, may be better to follow the PEP8 Coding style ? same below
I've run autopep8, which doesn't deal with strings - https://github.com/hhatto/autopep8/issues/39
Can we be specific about types of exceptions instead of using wider scope
Yes, if there is a need.
try/except
Ack
Also provide an option for the user to name the output binary?
snake_case as per PEP8 ? same for all functions & variable names
I've run autopep8

nit: pldmFwUpPkg.close()
os.remove(<binary>)
We can close the o/p package file and clean up before we invoke sys.exit() ? Or probably throw from here?
sys.exit() throws an exception and the exception is caught and the cleanup is done.
Ack
nit: Probably needs a 16 byte check. We could instead generate this number from the script only, no? We could take spec revision as input parameter and generate this parameter.

> We could take spec revision as input parameter and generate this parameter.
I did give it a thought, personally didn't find great value in the version -> uuid indirection, compared to specifying the UUID directly.
If the script accepts the version ID, then the same metadata file can be used to generate version specific PLDM package. Anyway, nit comment only.

Sure, there will be value in accepting the Version ID, once the script is flexible enough to handle multiple versions. Even the JSON structure might need to change to support multiple versions. This is can be part of a future enhancement.
Ack
Probably we can throw from here / cleanup the o/p package file before exiting.
sys.exit() throws an exception and the exception is caught and the cleanup is done.
We are looking at additional descriptors (for PCI device), probably can submit as a patch on top of this
Please do submit patches if there is interest in additional descriptors.

Do we have to exit here? Can we "continue" instead? Say, if someone wants to have the option to "reset" the continue component after failure, they can simply skip keeping this flag in the metadata file.

DeviceUpdateOptionsFlags supports only bit 0, this check is for that. 

The json supports the option to select both.

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/pldm/+/42454/2/tools/fw-update/metadata-example.json#10

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/pldm/+/42454/2/tools/fw-update/metadata-example.json#24
Ack
Not required? len(applicable_components) need to be multiple of 8, no?
The number of components is not guaranteed to be a multiple of 8. So round() will adjust the applicable_components_bitfield to accommodate the components.

The component_bitmap_bit_length is a multiple of 8, thus I gather that applicable_components should also be multiple of 8.

Even if we want to handle this "not a multiple of 8" case, mat.ceil() needs to be used. round() will round off to the nearest integer value, this means that something like 5.125 will be rounded off to 5 instead of 6.

> The number of components is not guaranteed to be a multiple of 8. So round() will adjust the applicable_components_bitfield to accommodate the components.

Ignore my earlier comment.

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/pldm/+/42454/2/tools/fw-update/pldm_fwup_pkg_creator.py#113 calculates the component bit map length by using math.ceil(). So applicable_components_bitfield_length is expected to be a multiple of 8.(8,16,24,32). len(applicable_components)/8 returns 1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0. So round() gets it to a whole number.
Right. Since applicable_components is guaranteed to be a multiple of 8 (in the codeflow), do we need the round() function?
Yeah, struct.pack() later cribs if not an integer.
same here and everywhere else
sys.exit() throws an exception and the exception is caught and the cleanup is done.
Ack
based on spec revision, we will have to support downstream device identification are also, no ?
Yes, DSP0236 1.1.0 supports downstream devices in the package. I don't have a use case for that now. Definitely the json and tool can be extended to address that in the future.
Ack
sha bang shoud always be the first line.
Ack

there should not be a space between sha and bang.

without that, this script will not work when executed with ./<pldm_fwup_pkg_creator.py>
Ack
